revised_title: Ancient Greek Music Scales and Species
tldr: The author discusses the various genera and species of ancient music, focusing on the Greek music scales and their component intervals. He explains the differences between the diatonic, chromatic, and enharmonic genera and their respective species, providing examples of each. The author also addresses common misconceptions about ancient Greek music and its scales, arguing that they were not as out of tune as modern scholars may believe.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Musicology
